thread.title: Mount Vernon beats Tipton to clinch home playoff game
thread.title_full: Mount Vernon beats Tipton to clinch home playoff game

title: Mount Vernon beats Tipton to clinch home playoff game
text:
Mount Vernon beats Tipton to clinch home playoff game Mount Vernon beats Tipton to clinch home playoff game Adams throws 5 TD passes in 44-7 rout Prep Football , Mount Vernon , Tipton , Photos Mount Vernon’s Drew Adams looks to pass during the second quarter of their high school football game against Anamosa in Mount Vernon, Iowa, on Friday, Oct. 9, 2015. (Jim Slosiarek/The Gazette) Most Popular October 23, 2015 | 10:34 pm 
TIPTON — Mount Vernon’s Drew Adams threw an incompletion on his first pass attempt. 
The sophomore quarterback didn’t miss many after that. 
Adams threw for 284 yards and a season-best five touchdowns to lead the Mustangs to an impressive 44-7 road win at Tipton Friday night to clinch second place in Class 2A, District 4. 
Mount Vernon will host a first round playoff game on Wednesday night. 
“Home-field advantage is very important for us,” Mount Vernon Coach Lance Pedersen said. “Our kids put us in a position to do that today and I’m excited for what we call the new season. Our goal right now is to be 1-0 next week.” 
The Mustangs (7-2, 5-1) racked up 547 total yards — the bulk of it in the first three quarters. 
Adams completed 16 of his next 18 passes after that first miss, connecting on 11 straight at one point. Adams finished 21 of 26 with no interceptions and TD passes to four different receivers. 
Mount Vernon jumped to a 7-0 lead on its second series of the game and never stopped. 
Adams connected with receiver Connor Herrmann for TD passes of 16 and 14 yards in the second quarter to push the lead to 19-0. 
Later in the quarter, Adams underthrew a deep ball to Jake Randall, but the Tipton defender slipped as the ball arrived. Randall caught it and easily turned up field for a 39-yard score. 
“Our offense continues to move along and move forward,” Pedersen said. “We have a lot of different weapons. That’s fun and that’s exciting.” 
Mount Vernon’s Jack Cochrane rushed for 119 yards and two touchdowns. Cochrane also caught a 12-yard TD. 
Tipton quarterback Adam Hermsen ran for a 16-yard touchdown in the second quarter for the Tigers’ lone score. 
Tipton (7-2, 4-2) finished third in the district and will travel for a playoff game Wednesday. Your Next Prep Football Articles
